rules.title: No goto
rules.message: Never use goto. It creates unstructured control flow that is difficult to analyze and verify. Use structured control flow (if, while, for, switch) instead.

rules.title: No setjmp/longjmp
rules.message: Never use setjmp or longjmp. They create non-local jumps that bypass normal control flow and make code impossible to analyze statically.

rules.title: No Dynamic Memory Allocation
rules.message: Never use malloc, free, calloc, or realloc. Dynamic memory allocation introduces unpredictable behavior, fragmentation, and potential for memory leaks. Use static allocation with fixed-size buffers.

rules.title: No Conditional Compilation
rules.message: Never use #ifdef or #if. Conditional compilation creates multiple code paths that may not all be tested. Use runtime configuration or compile separate variants.

rules.title: No Double Pointer Dereference
rules.message: Never use double pointer dereference (**ptr). It indicates overly complex data structures. Flatten data structures or use single indirection with explicit indexing.

rules.title: No Chained Pointer Access
rules.message: Never chain pointer dereferences (->field->field). It indicates overly coupled data structures. Use local variables to break the chain.

rules.title: No Unbounded Loops
rules.message: Never use unbounded loops (while(1), while(true), for(;;)). All loops must have a fixed upper bound that can be statically verified.
